member.name: T:NSubstitute.Arg.Compat
member.summary:
Alternate version of matchers for compatibility with pre-C#7 compilers which do not support ref return types. Do not use unless you are unable to use .
For more information see Compatibility Argument Matchers in the NSubstitute documentation.

member.name: F:NSubstitute.ClearOptions.ReturnValues
member.summary: Clear all configured return results (including auto-substituted values).

member.name: F:NSubstitute.ClearOptions.CallActions

member.name: F:NSubstitute.ClearOptions.All
member.summary: Clears all received calls and configured return values and callbacks.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Compatibility.CompatArg
member.summary:
Alternate version of matchers for compatibility with pre-C#7 compilers which do not support ref return types. Do not use unless you are unable to use .
provides a non-static version of , which can make it easier to use from an abstract base class. You can get a reference to this instance using the static field.
For more information see Compatibility Argument Matchers in the NSubstitute documentation.

member.summary: Provides a specification for arguments for use with . Can additionally implement to give descriptions when arguments do not match.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.Arguments.IArgumentMatcher.IsSatisfiedBy(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether the satisfies the condition of the matcher. If this throws an exception the argument will be treated as non-matching.

member.summary: Checks whether the satisfies the condition of the matcher. If this throws an exception the argument will be treated as non-matching.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.CallCollection.IReceivedCallEntry
member.summary: Performance optimization. Allows to mark call as deleted without allocating extra wrapper. To play safely, we track ownership, so object can be re-used only once.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.CallCollection.ReceivedCallEntry
member.summary: Wrapper to track that particular entry was deleted. That is needed because concurrent collections don't have a Delete method. Notice, in most cases the original instance will be used as a wrapper itself.

member.name: P:NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the nth argument to this call.
member.returns: The value of the argument at the given index

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo.Args
member.summary: Get the arguments passed to this call.
member.returns: Array of all arguments passed to this call

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo.ArgTypes
member.summary: Gets the types of all the arguments passed to this call.
member.returns: Array of types of all arguments passed to this call

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo.Arg``1
member.summary: Gets the argument of type `T` passed to this call. This will throw if there are no arguments of this type, or if there is more than one matching argument.
member.typeparam: The type of the argument to retrieve
member.returns: The argument passed to the call, or throws if there is not exactly one argument of this type

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo.ArgAt``1(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the argument passed to this call at the specified zero-based position, converted to type `T`. This will throw if there are no arguments, if the argument is out of range or if it cannot be converted to the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type of the argument to retrieve
member.param: The zero-based position of the argument to retrieve
member.returns: The argument passed to the call, or throws if there is not exactly one argument of this type

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.ConfiguredCall.AndDoes(System.Action{NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo})
member.summary: Adds a callback to execute for matching calls.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.INSubContainer.Customize
member.summary: Creates a new container based on the current one, which can be configured to override the existing registrations without affecting the existing container.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.INSubContainer.CreateScope
member.summary: Create an explicit scope, so all dependencies with the lifetime are preserved for multiple resolve requests.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.IConfigurableNSubContainer.Decorate``1(System.Func{``0,NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.INSubResolver,``0})
member.summary: Decorates the original implementation with a custom decorator. The factory method is provided with an original implementation instance. The lifetime of decorated implementation is used.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.NSubContainer
member.summary: Tiny and very limited implementation of the DI services. Container supports the following features required by NSubstitute: - Registration by type with automatic constructor injection - Registration of factory methods for the complex objects - Support of the most required lifetimes: - - - - Immutability (via interfaces) and customization by creating a nested container

member.name: F:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.NSubLifetime.Singleton
member.summary: Value is created only once.

member.name: F:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.NSubLifetime.PerScope
member.summary: Value is created only once per scope. Allows to share the same instance across the objects in the same graph. If no explicit scope is created, an implicit scope is created per single resolve request.

member.name: F:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.NSubLifetime.Transient
member.summary: New value is created for each time.

member.name: P:NSubstitute.Core.DependencyInjection.NSubstituteDefaultFactory.DefaultContainer
member.summary: The default NSubstitute registrations. Feel free to configure the existing container to customize and override NSubstitute parts.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.Extensions.IsCompatibleWith(System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: Checks if the instance can be used when a is expected.

member.summary: Join the using .

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.Extensions.AsArray``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Tries to cast sequence to array first before making a new array sequence.

member.name: P:NSubstitute.Core.ICallBaseConfiguration.CallBaseByDefault
member.summary: Gets or sets whether base method should be called by default.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.ICallBaseConfiguration.Exclude(NSubstitute.Core.ICallSpecification)
member.summary: Specifies whether base method should be always ignored for the matching call. If method is both explicitly excluded and included, base method is _not_ called.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.ICallBaseConfiguration.Include(NSubstitute.Core.ICallSpecification)
member.summary: Specifies whether base method should be called for the matching call. If method is both explicitly excluded and included, base method is _not_ called.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.ICallBaseConfiguration.ShouldCallBase(NSubstitute.Core.ICall)
member.summary: Tests whether base method should be called for the call given the existing configuration.

member.name: P:NSubstitute.Core.ICallRouter.CallBaseByDefault
member.summary: Specifies whether base method should be called by default.
member.remarks: This configuration is considered only when base method exists (e.g. you created a substitute for the AbstractType with method implementation).

member.summary: Factory method which creates from the .

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.ICallIndependentReturn
member.summary: Performance optimization. Allows to not construct if configured result doesn't depend on it.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.IThreadLocalContext.UseNextRoute(NSubstitute.Core.ICallRouter)
member.summary: Returns the previously configured next route and resets the stored value. If route was configured for the different router, returns and persist the route info.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.IThreadLocalContext.UsePendingRaisingEventArgumentsFactory
member.summary: Returns the previously set arguments factory and resets the stored value.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Core.IThreadLocalContext.RunInQueryContext(System.Action,NSubstitute.Core.IQuery)
member.summary: Invokes the passed callback in a context of the specified query.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.Maybe`1
member.summary: Particularly poor implementation of Maybe/Option type. This is just filling an immediate need; use FSharpOption or XSharpx or similar for a real implementation.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Core.RobustThreadLocal`1
member.summary: Delegates to ThreadLocal<T>, but wraps Value property access in try/catch to swallow ObjectDisposedExceptions. These can occur if the Value property is accessed from the finalizer thread. Because we can't detect this, we'll just swallow the exception (the finalizer thread won't be using any of the values from thread local storage anyway).

member.name: T:NSubstitute.ReceivedExtensions.Quantity
member.summary: Represents a quantity. Primarily used for specifying a required amount of calls to a member.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.ReceivedExtensions.Quantity.Within(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: A non-zero quantity between the given minimum and maximum numbers (inclusive).
member.param: Minimum quantity (inclusive). Must be greater than or equal to 0.
Maximum quantity (inclusive). Must be greater than minInclusive.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.ReceivedExtensions.Quantity.Matches``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns whether the given collection contains the required quantity of items.
member.returns: true if the collection has the required quantity; otherwise false.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.ReceivedExtensions.Quantity.RequiresMoreThan``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0})
member.summary: Returns whether the given collections needs more items to satisfy the required quantity.
member.returns: true if the collection needs more items to match this quantity; otherwise false.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.ReceivedExtensions.Quantity.Describe(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Describe this quantity using the given noun variants. For example, `Describe("item", "items")` could return the description: "more than 1 item, but less than 10 items".
member.returns: A string describing the required quantity of items identified by the provided noun forms.

member.summary: Raise an event for an EventHandler<TEventArgs> event with the substitute as the sender and the provided .

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Raise.EventWith``1
member.summary: Raise an event for an EventHandler<EventArgsT> event with the substitute as the sender and with a default instance of .

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Raise.Event
member.summary: Raise an event for an EventHandler or EventHandler<EventArgs> event with the substitute as the sender and with empty EventArgs.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Raise.Event``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Raise an event of type with the provided arguments. If no arguments are provided NSubstitute will try to provide reasonable defaults.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Raise.FixParamsArrayAmbiguity(System.Object[],System.Type)
member.summary: If delegate takes single parameter of array type, it's impossible to distinguish whether input array represents all arguments, or the first argument only. If we find that ambiguity might happen, we wrap user input in an extra array.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Received.InOrder(System.Action)
member.summary: Asserts the calls to the substitutes contained in the given Action were received by these substitutes in the same order. Calls to property getters are not included in the assertion.
member.param: Action containing calls to substitutes in the expected order

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Routing.Handlers.ClearLastCallRouterHandler
member.summary: Clears last call router on SubstitutionContext for routes that do not require it.
member.remarks: This is to help prevent static state bleeding over into future calls.

member.name: T:NSubstitute.Substitute
member.summary: Create a substitute for one or more types. For example: Substitute.For<ISomeType>()

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Substitute.For``1(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Substitute for an interface or class.
Be careful when specifying a class, as all non-virtual members will actually be executed. Only virtual members can be recorded or have return values specified.
member.typeparam: The type of interface or class to substitute.
member.param: Arguments required to construct a class being substituted. Not required for interfaces or classes with default constructors.
member.returns: A substitute for the interface or class.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Substitute.For``2(System.Object[])

summary.para: Substitute for multiple interfaces or a class that implements an interface. At most one class can be specified.
Be careful when specifying a class, as all non-virtual members will actually be executed. Only virtual members can be recorded or have return values specified.

member.typeparam: The type of interface or class to substitute.
An additional interface or class (maximum of one class) the substitute should implement.
member.param: Arguments required to construct a class being substituted. Not required for interfaces or classes with default constructors.
member.returns: A substitute of type T1, that also implements T2.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Substitute.For``3(System.Object[])
member.summary:
Substitute for multiple interfaces or a class that implements multiple interfaces. At most one class can be specified. If additional interfaces are required use the overload.
Be careful when specifying a class, as all non-virtual members will actually be executed. Only virtual members can be recorded or have return values specified.
member.typeparam: The type of interface or class to substitute.
An additional interface or class (maximum of one class) the substitute should implement.
An additional interface or class (maximum of one class) the substitute should implement.
member.param: Arguments required to construct a class being substituted. Not required for interfaces or classes with default constructors.
member.returns: A substitute of type T1, that also implements T2 and T3.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Substitute.For(System.Type[],System.Object[])

summary.para: Substitute for multiple interfaces or a class that implements multiple interfaces. At most one class can be specified.
Be careful when specifying a class, as all non-virtual members will actually be executed. Only virtual members can be recorded or have return values specified.

member.param: The types of interfaces or a type of class and multiple interfaces the substitute should implement.
Arguments required to construct a class being substituted. Not required for interfaces or classes with default constructors.
member.returns: A substitute implementing the specified types.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.Substitute.ForPartsOf``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Create a substitute for a class that behaves just like a real instance of the class, but also records calls made to its virtual members and allows for specific members to be substituted by using When(() => call).DoNotCallBase() or by setting a value to return value for that member.
member.typeparam: The type to substitute for parts of. Must be a class; not a delegate or interface.
member.returns: An instance of the class that will execute real methods when called, but allows parts to be selectively overridden via `Returns` and `When..DoNotCallBase`.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.Received``1(``0)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has received the following call.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.Received``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has received the following call the required number of times.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.DidNotReceive``1(``0)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has not received the following call.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ReceivedWithAnyArgs``1(``0)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has received the following call with any arguments.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ReceivedWithAnyArgs``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has received the following call with any arguments the required number of times.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.DidNotReceiveWithAnyArgs``1(``0)
member.summary: Checks this substitute has not received the following call with any arguments.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ReceivedCalls``1(``0)
member.summary: Returns the calls received by this substitute.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ClearReceivedCalls``1(``0)
member.summary: Forget all the calls this substitute has received.
member.remarks: Note that this will not clear any results set up for the substitute using Returns(). See for more options with resetting a substitute.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.Returns``1(``0,``0,``0[])
member.summary: Set a return value for this call.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.Returns``1(``0,System.Func{NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo,``0},System.Func{NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo,``0}[])
member.summary: Set a return value for this call, calculated by the provided function.
member.param: Function to calculate the return value

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ReturnsForAnyArgs``1(``0,``0,``0[])
member.summary: Set a return value for this call made with any arguments.

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.ReturnsForAnyArgs``1(``0,System.Func{NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo,``0},System.Func{NSubstitute.Core.CallInfo,``0}[])
member.summary: Set a return value for this call made with any arguments, calculated by the provided function.
member.param: Function to calculate the return value

member.name: M:NSubstitute.SubstituteExtensions.Returns``1(System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0},``0,``0[])
member.summary: Set a return value for this call. The value(s) to be returned will be wrapped in Tasks.
member.param: Value to return. Will be wrapped in a Task

member.param: Function to calculate the return value

member.summary: Set a return value for this call made with any arguments, calculated by the provided function. The value(s) to be returned will be wrapped in Tasks.
member.param: Function to calculate the return value

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is allowed as an input even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that null is disallowed as an input even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that an output will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter may be null even if the corresponding type disallows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter may be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that when a method returns , the parameter will not be null even if the corresponding type allows it.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the output will be non-null if the named parameter is non-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the associated parameter name.
member.param: The associated parameter name. The output will be non-null if the argument to the parameter specified is non-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute.ParameterName
member.summary: Gets the associated parameter name.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: Applied to a method that will never return under any circumstance.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method will not return if the associated Boolean parameter is passed the specified value.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified parameter value.
member.param: The condition parameter value. Code after the method will be considered unreachable by diagnostics if the argument to the associated parameter matches this value.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute.ParameterValue
member.summary: Gets the condition parameter value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with a field or property member.
member.param: The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the list of field and property members.
member.param: The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: Specifies that the method or property will ensure that the listed field and property members have not-null values when returning with the specified return value condition.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and a field or property member.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The field or property member that is promised to be not-null.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes the attribute with the specified return value condition and list of field and property members.
member.param: The return value condition. If the method returns this value, the associated parameter will not be null.
The list of field and property members that are promised to be not-null.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets the return value condition.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute.Members
member.summary: Gets field or property member names.
